authors.name: Nontaphat Thongsin

authors.name: Methichit Wattanapanitch
authors.affiliation: Siriraj Center for Regenerative Medicine, Research Department, Faculty of Medicine Siriraj Hospital, Mahidol University, Bangkok, Thailand

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"fnar6","text":"Immunotherapy has emerged as a promising therapeutic approach for treating several forms of cancer. Adoptive cell transfer of immune cells, such as natural killer (NK) cells, provides a powerful therapeutic potential against tumor cells. In the past decades, two-dimensional (2D) tumor models have been used to investigate the effectiveness of immune cell killing. However, the 2D tumor models exhibit less structural complexity and cannot recapitulate the physiological condition of the tumor microenvironment. Thus, the effectiveness of immune cells against tumor cells using these models cannot fully be translated to clinical studies. In order to gain a deeper insight into immune cell-tumor interaction, more physiologically relevant in vivo-like three-dimensional (3D) tumor models have been developed. These 3D tumor models can mimic the dynamic cellular activities, making them much closer to the in vivo tumor profiles. Here, we describe a simple and effective protocol to study the cytotoxic activity of primary human NK cells toward the 3D tumor spheroids. Our protocol includes isolation and expansion of human NK cells, labeling and formation of tumor spheroids, co-culture of NK cells and tumor spheroids, and evaluation of cytotoxic activity using a confocal microscope. This protocol is also applicable to other types of tumors and immune cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

journal.citation: Thongsin N, Wattanapanitch M (2022) A three-dimensional immune-oncology model for studying in vitro primary human NK cell cytotoxic activity. PLOS ONE 17(3): e0264366. https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0264366

steps.section: Isolation and expansion of peripheral blood NK (PB-NK) cells
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"18dav","text":"Isolation of PB-NK cells by negative selection using NK cell isolation kit","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":74}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"90v9g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"27bo7","text":"We isolate peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs) from 30 ml of peripheral blood collected in vacutainer® EDTA blood collection tubes using density gradient centrifugation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":108,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dcl5q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9v6oh","text":"Collect 30 ml of peripheral blood to vacutainer® EDTA blood collection tube and mix the blood thoroughly by inverting.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":47,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5aoeb","text":"Transfer 15 ml of blood to two 50-ml conical tubes.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5vhld","text":"Add 15 ml of 1× PBS to the blood and mix thoroughly using a sterile serological pipette.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"jl84","text":"Prepare two 50-ml conical tubes containing 9 ml of IsoPrep.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6f60u","text":"Gently overlay 30 ml of diluted blood onto the IsoPrep layer using a sterile serological pipette and centrifuge at 800 × g for 30 min, acceleration = 5 and break = off at room temperature.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b0h03","text":"Remove plasma layer using a transfer pipette.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1cc63","text":"Collect the PBMCs to a 50-ml conical tube using a transfer pipette.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a7b8g","text":"Wash the cells with 20 ml of 1× PBS and centrifuge at 400 × g for 10 min at room temperature.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"804i6","text":"Repeat the washing step (step 8).","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6p034","text":"After centrifugation, discard the supernatant and resuspend the cell pellet with 10 ml of basal RPMI-1640 medium.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1j9et","text":"Perform cell counting using trypan blue exclusion assay to determine the cell number and viability.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6lnba","text":"Perform PB-NK cell isolation using the MojoSort™ Human NK cell Isolation Kit following the manufacturer’s instruction.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"crgmv","text":"Resuspend the cell pellet with the PB-NK culture medium and centrifuge the cells at 500 × g for 10 min at room temperature.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8fdfq","text":"During centrifugation, perform cell counting using trypan blue exclusion assay to determine the cell number and viability.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eonhr","text":"After centrifugation, resuspend the cell pellet with the PB-NK culture medium and collect 1 × 106 viable cells for PB-NK cell expansion, 4 × 105 viable cells for flow cytometric analysis, and cryopreserve using CryoStor® at a density of 2 × 106 viable cells/ml/vial.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":96,"length":2},{"style":"sup","offset":143,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":219,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":243,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation and expansion of peripheral blood NK (PB-NK) cells
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f0s34","text":"Expansion of PB-NK cells","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4f9qo","text":"\nExpansion of the PB-NK cells is performed using the genetically modified mIL-21-K562 cell line irradiated with γ-radiation at 10,000 rad. One-day post-irradiation, the mIL-21-K562 cell line is cryopreserved in the mIL-21-K562 cryopreservation medium.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"256bt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9n58p","text":"Quickly thaw the cryopreserved irradiated mIL-21-K562 cells in a 37 C water bath until only a small ice crystal remains.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aaoqh","text":"Wipe the outside of the cryogenic vial with 70% ethanol.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7jmok","text":"Transfer the cell suspension using a transfer pipette to a 15-ml conical tube containing 9 ml of basal RPMI-1640 medium and take out 10 μl of the cell suspension for counting.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7aac7","text":"Centrifuge the cells at 500 × g for 5 min at room temperature.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ccr4","text":"During centrifugation, perform cell counting using trypan blue exclusion assay to determine the cell number and viability.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7jd2q","text":"After centrifugation, discard the supernatant and resuspend the cell pellet with 1 ml of PB-NK culture medium.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2snac","text":"Co-culture the PB-NK cells (Heading 1, step 15) with the irradiated mIL-21-K562 cells at a 1:2 ratio at a seeding density of 3 × 105 PB-NK cells/ml in the PB-NK culture medium and incubate at 37 C, 5% CO2.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":131,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ebogb","text":"Change the PB-NK culture medium every three days and add freshly thawed irradiated mIL-21-K562 cells at 1:1 ratio every six days.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation and expansion of peripheral blood NK (PB-NK) cells
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e4996","text":"Evaluation of the sorted PB-NK cells using flow cytometry","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":57}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eur5l","text":"\nWe perform flow cytometric analysis to determine the purity of the PB-NK cells after cell sorting and expansion by staining with the common NK cell markers including CD45, CD3, and CD56. NK cells are identified by CD45+ CD3- CD56+ population.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":219,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":224,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":230,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"acvo0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1sdk6","text":"Centrifuge the cell suspension (Heading 1, step 15) at 500 × g for 5 min at room temperature.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a89pe","text":"Discard the supernatant and block the potential non-specific binding using 100 μl of 10% human AB serum in FAC buffer for 30 min at 4 C.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1am8d","text":"Add 0.2 μl of Zombie Violet™ Fixable Viability Kit, vortex briefly, and transfer 50 μl of the cell suspension into two 5-ml round-bottom tubes for the NK cell marker and the isotype control staining.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5gf87","text":"Add 1 μl of the fluorescence-conjugated anti-human CD45, CD3, and CD56 or the fluorescence-conjugated isotype control to the cell suspension. Incubate for 15 min in the dark.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1m3k2","text":"Add 3 ml of FAC buffer, vortex briefly, and centrifuge at 500 × g for 5 min at room temperature.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"30tiu","text":"Discard the supernatant and fix the cells using 500 μl of 1% paraformaldehyde. The stained cells can be stored at 4 C for up to 2 weeks.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3qsl8","text":"Determine the percentage of NK cell population using a flow cytometer (LSRFortessa™) and the FlowJo software. Exclude the dead cells, which stained positive for Zombie Violet™.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6pm9u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e5brt","text":"For the 3D spheroid formation, the cholangiocarcinoma cell line (KKU213A) is cultured in the medium containing 2.5% Matrigel® matrix on an ultra-low attachment round-bottom 96-well plate for two days.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":124,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aie7o","text":"\n KKU213A cell line passaging","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":1,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6dn0v","text":"\nPassaging is performed when the cells reach 70-80% confluence, usually 3-4 days, and the cells are seeded onto a 25-cm2 cell culture flask.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":119,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"368up","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"91tf8","text":"Aspirate the culture medium and wash the cells with 3 ml of 1 × PBS.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"66c0c","text":"Add 1 ml of 0.1% trypsin-EDTA and incubate the cells at 37 C for 5 min.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a2s9c","text":"After incubation, add 4 ml of DMEM/F-12 medium and resuspend the cells vigorously using a serological pipette.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"88qim","text":"Transfer the cell suspension to a 15-ml conical tube, take out 10 μl of the cell suspension for counting, and centrifuge the cells at 500 × g for 5 min at room temperature.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aua35","text":"During centrifugation, perform cell counting using the trypan blue exclusion assay to determine the cell number and viability.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6e97k","text":"After centrifugation, discard the supernatant and resuspend the cell pellet with 1 ml culture medium.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"adr6g","text":"Transfer 1.5 × 105 viable cells to a 25-cm2 culture flask containing 5 ml culture medium and incubate at 37 C, 5% CO2.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":17,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":42,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":117,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a5ejb","text":"KKU213A cell line labeling using CFSE","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":37}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ej9h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"br4i9","text":"Aspirate the culture medium and dissociate the cell using 0.1% trypsin-EDTA (Heading 4, steps 1-6).","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5fi3e","text":"Transfer 2 × 105 viable cells to a 15-ml conical tube, wash with 1 ml of 1 × PBS and centrifuge at 500 × g for 5 min at room temperature.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":15,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9in72","text":"Discard the supernatant and resuspend the cell pellet with 1 ml of 1 × PBS.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ed2g2","text":"Add 2.5 μM CFSE solution to the cell suspension, vortex briefly, and incubate at 37 C, 5% CO2 for 20 min in the dark.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":93,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b9d8v","text":"After incubation, add 5 ml of the KKU213A culture medium to the cell suspension and centrifuge at 500 × g for 5 min at room temperature.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"88b23","text":"Discard the supernatant and resuspend the cell pellet with 1 ml of the culture medium.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"be6gn","text":"Formation of 3D tumor spheroids","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eu7cd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6l062","text":"Prepare the KKU213A culture medium containing 2.5% Matrigel® matrix and chill the medium on ice.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":59,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cnuq6","text":"Aliquot appropriate cell number of the CFSE-labeled KKU213A cells (Heading 5) to a 15-ml conical tube and centrifuge at 500 × g for 5 min at room temperature.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2m8n","text":"Resuspend the CFSE-labeled KKU213A cells with the pre-chilled KKU213A culture medium containing 2.5% Matrigel® matrix.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":109,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1u9t7","text":"Seed the CFSE-labeled KKU213A cells onto an ultra-low attachment round-bottom 96-well plate at a seeding density of 2 × 103 cells/100 μl culture medium.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":122,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9htdf","text":"Centrifuge the 96-well plate at 1,000 × g for 10 min at 4 C and incubate at 37 C, 5% CO2 for two days.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":89,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dopil","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7lsa5","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cu7sg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":2,"offset":13,"style":"sup"},{"length":1,"offset":57,"style":"sup"},{"length":1,"offset":145,"style":"sup"}],"key":"1j2uo","text":"Thaw Matrigel® at 4 C overnight and always keep Matrigel® under 4 C until use to prevent gelation. Plasticware that is in contact with Matrigel® should be pre-chilled before use.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6g23h","text":"Cytotoxic activity is performed by co-culturing the expanded PB-NK cells with the tumor spheroids at 1:1, 2.5:1, 5:1, and 10:1 (effector: target) ratios for three days. Cytotoxic activity can be determined by the fluorescence intensity of propidium iodide (PI), which stained positive for dead cells, using a confocal microscope.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3v15a","text":"
 Co-culture of PB-NK cells with KKU213A tumor spheroids","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":1,"length":55}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8bvfu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2sshm","text":"Change the medium of the PB-NK cells 24 h prior to co-culture.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"enjdr","text":"On day 2 of spheroid formation, transfer the PB-NK cells to a 15-ml conical tube, take out 10 μl of the cell suspension for counting, and centrifuge at 500 × g for 5 min at room temperature.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4nfcf","text":"During centrifugation, perform cell counting using trypan blue exclusion assay to determine the cell number and viability.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ll9h","text":"After centrifugation, discard the supernatant, resuspend the cell pellet with 1 ml of PB-NK culture medium, and aliquot the appropriate number of PB-NK cells into a 15-ml conical tube for co-culture.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bhbdh","text":"Centrifuge at 500 × g for 5 min at room temperature.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fo37o","text":"Discard the supernatant and resuspend the cell pellet with an appropriate volume of PB-NK culture medium, without hIL-2 for co-culture, add 2 μg/ml of propidium iodide (PI) and mix vigorously using a sterile pipette.
 ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7gekc","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9773k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7bebq","text":"7. Add 100 μl of the suspended PB-NK cells to a well of the ultra-low attachment round-bottom 96-well plate.
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"786hi","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"csogn","text":" 8. Centrifuge 96-well plate at 1,000 × g for 10 min at 4 C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d24mb","text":" 9. Incubate the cells at 37 C, 5% CO2 for three days.
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":38,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"41n53","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8ilbg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"66qgt","text":"The volume of PB-NK culture medium is 100 μl/well.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"jpqn","text":"Gently add the PB-NK cells to avoid disturbing the spheroids. Total volume of culture medium is 200 μl/well and the final concentration of PI is 1 μg/ml.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9ecj","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"buf7f","text":"We recommend performing 3 replicates for each ratio. Prepare control wells containing only the tumor spheroids for determining the spontaneous tumor cell death, and the tumor spheroids with 0.1% Triton X-100 for determining the maximum cell death.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5sb9t","text":"Evaluation of cytotoxic activity using a live imaging confocal microscope","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":73}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"m46g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7kp87","text":"1. After three days of co-culture, determine the mean fluorescence intensity (MFI) of PI under a confocal microscope.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5nm9q","text":"2. Cytotoxic activity of the PB-NK cells can be calculated using the following formula:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"74fee","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ug4k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5bvm6","text":"%Specific killing=  [(Experimental MFI-Spontaneous MFI)]/([(Maximum MFI-Spontaneous MFI)])  ×100","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1unhn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2aavq","text":"The experimental MFI represents the mean fluorescence intensity of PI in the presence of effectors at a given effector to target (E: T) ratio, whereas the spontaneous MFI represents the mean fluorescence intensity of PI in the absence of effector cells. Maximum MFI represents the mean fluorescence intensity of PI from tumor spheroids that are treated with 0.1% Triton™ X-100.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: A three-dimensional immune-oncology model for studying in vitro human NK cell cytotoxic activity
